intro: Sphenopholis interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted sphenophyllum, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the family Sphenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring a distinctive interrupted pattern along the midrib. This plant exhibits a climbing habit, often found in moist, shaded environments within temperate forests. Its reproductive structures include sporangia that are arranged in clusters along the leaf margins. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, Sphenopholis interrupta is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
